item.title: The double dual trick to construct a better object from the existing one
item.description: Stone–Čech compactification One of the proof of the Stone–Čech compactification is to consider the continuous functions from a given topological space $X$ to $[0, 1]$. Crux 1: constructing $[0, 1]^{C}$ Let $C$ be the space of all continuous functions from $X$ to $[0, 1]$, consider $[0, 1]^{C}$, there is a natural map from $X$ to $[0, 1]^{C}$: for each $x \in X$, define $\phi(x) = f \mapsto f(x)$. With product topology $\phi$ is continuous.
